intro: Trevia macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stalked trevia, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikelets, typical of grasses. Trevia macrostachya is often found in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and biodiversity.
